p.b: This document describes the installation process for HPE Helion OpenStack 1.1 and HPE Helion OpenStack 1.1.1.

body.p: (If you already have 1.1 installed, you can update Helion OpenStack from 1.1 to 1.1.1 by following the update procedures described in HPE Helion OpenStack 1.1.1 Update Guide.)
Edit the JSON file based on the applicable scenario:

section.title: Configuration variables file for a KVM install
section.p: Identify the configuration variables required for the installation based on the deployment scenario.

If you plan to use custom IP addresses in your HPE Helion OpenStack deployment, open the JSON file in the installation package named kvm-custom-ips.json and edit the following environment variables. Save the file on the seed cloud host (installation system). The variables are defined in used during install
All VLAN IDs and IP addresses given in the following procedure are examples of customized IP addresses and VLAN identifiers for external network access.

li.p: Log into your install system as root.
Locate the kvm-custom-ips.json in the /tripleo/config directory. This directory is created when the installation package is extracted.
Optionally, make a backup copy of the JSON file in case it is needed.
Open the kvm-custom-ips.json file and edit the environment variable listed below.
Save the file on the seed cloud host.

ol.li: Return to HPE Helion OpenStack Installation Prerequisites.
